newsitem.title: USA: Business Objects sees weak Q2 results.
newsitem.headline: Business Objects sees weak Q2 results.

text.p: Business Objects warned Tuesday earnings for its second quarter would fall below analysts' expectations.
The company said in a statement it expects to report breakeven net income for the second quarter, ended June 30, on revenues of about $26 million.

Analysts had predicted the company would earn $0.09 a share for the quarter, according to First Call. In the comparable year-ago quarter the company had profits of $1.9 million, or $0.11 a share, on revenues of $21.9 million.
The company said its revenues were hurt by a stronger dollar. Using the exchange rates of the second quarter of last year, revenue would have been over $1 million higher.

Other factors that hurt results were higher than expected expenses related to recent acquisitions of its distributors in Italy and Switzerland as well as higher expenses from the addition of personnel and marketing programs in the U.S.
